intro: Oldenlandia staelioides, commonly known as the silverleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers with five petals, which bloom in clusters during the warm season. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance and contributing to its common name. Oldenlandia staelioides is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors or stream banks.
